page.title: 06CONTROLLED PACKAGING SERVICE
page.content: Controlled Packaging Services Ltd. has now been open for about 17 years and during that time the firm have made boxes for things like brake pads for the Boeing 757,steel rollers, racing cars, detonators, a wall for a Pop group,an igloo for a mountaineer- ing expedition and food for Ethiopian Famine Relief. A millionaire Arab sultan ordered packaging for porcelain gold and silver worth Â£1,125,000. CPS make a lot of boxes for the RSPCA and the Armed Forces. Materials used include fibreglass, fibreboard,timber and 3 types of foam. CPS has 60 employees who all do more than one job and share in the profits. A gold-coloured plaque at the Harrison building to which the firm moved in 1983 states that it was offcially opened by Dennis Thatcher,MBE,husband of the Prime Minister on 11.11.1983.
